intro: Dubautia knudsenii subsp. filiformis, commonly known as the filiform Dubautia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky areas. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
